Advanced Gunnery Control
items.summary: **A utility mod allowing you to customize weapon behavior on autofire, such as e.g. targeting/avoiding shields.**
items.description:
**A utility mod allowing you to customize weapon behavior on autofire, such as e.g. targeting/avoiding shields.**

Requires MagicLib and LazyLib. LunaLib is not required but recommended.

Install and press J in combat, in refit, or on the world map to open a GUI.

Features:
- Many tags, such as targeting or avoiding shields, PD mode and many many more
- GUI-based configuration in combat/refit or on the campaign map
- Ability to automate tags via automatic customizable suggested tags and fleet-wide weapon-composition based tags
- Tags are automatically saved between combats and reloads
- Seamlessly switch between simple mode (6 tags) and advanced mode (over 20 tags)
- Customize AI-controlled ship behavior through ship modes in advanced mode
- Customize most aspects of the mod through LunaLib settings
- Manually control multiple weapon groups at once using the Merge tag

Can be updated/added/removed to/from ongoing campaigns.

```
To mod-authors:
If you want to integrate with AGC to improve ship/weapon AI behavior of your faction, check the readme. Feel free to ping me if you need help or want to request a special mode.
Example integration code: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-symbiotic-void-creatures/blob/main/src/tecrys/svc/hullmods/BGECarapace.kt#L98
```

items.summary: A collection of 36 questionable quality low OP cost hull mods
items.description:
A collection of 36 questionable quality low OP cost hull mods 

v0.7 Save game compatible
```
    -Added a new hull mod, Internal Tanks - Essentially a fuel analog for cargo carver - has the same exclusions but it is stackable with cargo carver 
    -Added a new hull mod, External Tanks - Essentially a fuel analog for cargo pods - stackable with cargo pods - same deductions so it really makes a ship unwieldy if stacked
    -Adjusted Faraday cage by raising the hull deduction from 5% to 10% but increasing the flux from 50% to 60% - 5 was too low in retrospect but added 10% to help offset the increase
    -Adjusted PD Pep by increasing the Cr loss from 7% to 10% - 7 was a bit low and after testing 10 does have an effect but not so much it makes it useless to put on a ship
    -TY to SpiralMatai for bringing the above two hull mods in need of adjustment to my attention 
    -Updated the image on the forum OP and discord post with the new hull mods and edited it to be more even
    -Fixed an oversight with the faction's "known hull mods" for those that want the hull mods unlearned at start, it is now updated to include all CJHM hull mods ``` 
I am always open to ideas you may have for low cost hull mods so feel free to let me know and we can collaborate. You'll earn a coveted mention in the official changelog!

Changelog:
```Changes:
- Added the Keythong-class artillery cruiser. Fielded exclusively by the Church to bolster their lines with LIDAR-boosted long-range barrages. Slow, but capable of battering enemies before they can even think of fighting back.
- Added the Mothman-class phase cruiser. A heavy composite-component craft exclusively assembled at Kapteyn Starworks, featuring a vast ballistics-focused frontal battery supplemented by torpedoes and the ability to deploy phase-barriers. 
- Added the Minesweeper-class frigate. A small weapon platform specialized in point-defense escort duty.
- Added the Petard-class heavy bomber. An incredibly dangerous pirate bomber corvette that lugs four heavy guided fuel bombs to its target.
- Added the Wasp (P) class bomber. Fast and more fragile than the actual payload itself, pirate-modified Wasps are disposable in every way possible.
- A bunch of uh, stat tweaks to some existing content that I forgot to properly log. Vanguard-Orion, Herbert and Angst are a bit tankier, Stormsprite is a bit less silly.
```

Currently adds about 60 new automated ships and several types of derelict fighters to the game that are hopefully worth actually adding to your fleet. 
```
Changelog:
Version 0.0.16- Gaze Into The Abyss
-These change notes are reconstructed as the originals were lost, keep that in mind if you find undocumented features.
-Compatability with version 0.97 of Starsector
-Updated the sprite of the Fort
-Updated the sprite of most Mutant drones, less kitbash, more trash.
-Added the Evergreen, a massive megafreighter found in similar circumstances to other super-supply ships.
-Added Heavy Ballistic Integration to the Battlement, a small band-aid to help it with its' OP problems
-Reworked the Berserker 2, now with added support missiles.
-Reworked the Bersillion, now with heavy ballistic capability.
-Added the Penitent, a Pather-modified Redstone with a taste for triple hammer barrages.```
Can this mod be added to an existing save?```
 YES! And you will *not* miss any content by doing so.

items.name: Halo HomeSystems
items.summary: Adds threefactions: the UNSC, the Covenant, and the Ancients.
items.description:
Adds threefactions: the UNSC, the Covenant, and the Ancients.

COMPATABILITY 
 -Is compatible with Nexerelin.
-NOT COMPATIBLE WITH ORIGINAL OR EXPANDED UNSC MOD.

FEATURES:
The Covenant is a high tech and late-game faction to the game to the south east of the core worlds comprising 5 planets (sizes 9, 8, 7, 6, 6). Ships all have high flux cap and dissipation, but Covenant weapon flux usage is correspondingly high, take care when using these weapons on other craft, but have low(ish) armour and hull. EVERYONE HATES THE COVENANT.
Ships have a very high cost, default ships tend to accumulate flux quickly-ish even when firing and not taking damage.

The UNSC is a midline mid-late game faction northeast of the core worlds comprising 3 planets. Ships all have at least 1 axial ballistic shield-breaking MAC and love missiles and ballistic weapons. Especially hates the Covenant, and has actual relations with other factions unlike the Covenant.

The Ancients are high-tech and late-game (is there a pattern here?) series of hulls, fighters and weapons. They don't have a faction yet so their ships will spawn with Remnant fleets, albeit with a lower chance.

HULLMODs:
- Shield with code taken from Star Wars mod (I hope that's ok)
- Hullmods from original UNSC mod.

Assets taken from UNSC mod by AppleMarineXX and expansion by StargazerRJL mainly for weapons and some Covenant ships.
Sprites taken from Halo wiki and free-to-access artworks on Artstation by Jared Harris (most sprites from here).
Other sprites made using AI (since I can't art).

items.name: Java 21 - 1.2
items.summary: This mod lets Starsector work with Java 21. It does this by making some modifications to both Starsector's and Java's code as it is loaded. It only tweaks things to work, does not update any of starsectors libs nor does it repackage code. Because of this it will LIKELY work with most recent versions of Starsector.
items.description:
This mod lets Starsector work with Java 21. It does this by making some modifications to both Starsector's and Java's code as it is loaded. It only tweaks things to work, does not update any of starsectors libs nor does it repackage code. Because of this it will LIKELY work with most recent versions of Starsector.

Install instructions and full details of changes made are on the github page. If anyone wants to try this, I would love some feedback on if it makes Starsector run better/worse and if you get stuttering. Message me on here or post it as an issue on Github.

```
Changelog:
1.2
- Initial support files for mac and linux
1.1
- Fix for missing opens in vmparams preventing some OSs from saving games.
1.0 
- Initial release
- May stutter without increasing fps in settings.json, increasing fps will use more cpu.
```

FAQ: 
-Why Java 21? It is the currently released version.
-Will it work with older javas? It could but not currently.
-Will it work with newer javas? Untested, but probably until verification is mandatory.
-Will it work with Linux? Probably? The only thing stopping it would be if the vmparams stuff is different, like a shell script or something. I don't have linux so poke me if it doesn't work out of the box.

items.name: Leading Pip
items.summary: Adds a target leading pip in front of whatever ship you have targeted.
items.description:
Adds a target leading pip in front of whatever ship you have targeted.

If you shoot at that pip, you will generally hit the target.  The algorithm takes into account your position and velocity, your target's position and velocity, your weapon group, the positions of the weapons in the weapon group, and the projectile speed of the weapons in the weapon group.  Sometimes the target will be going too quickly to have any hope of hitting it, in which case the reticle may behave oddly, but this is rare.

items.name: More Combat Terrain Effects
items.summary: REQUIRES LAZYLIB, LUNALIB
items.description:
REQUIRES LAZYLIB, LUNALIB

Adds custom combat effects to all terrain that did not have an effect previously, and spruces up the rest.
Currently implemented:
```Magnetic field - Reduces weapon range, fighter range, missile maneuverability/guidance, vision range, and adds a small chance for missiles to have guidance scrambled.
Slipstream - Force SO on all ships, fighters, and MISSILES, (venting allowed but with reduced effectiveness, for things like excelsior), slowly passively generate hardflux.
Nebula (DISABLED BY DEFAULT): Nebula clouds reduce weapon range, vision, speed, and disable zero-flux boost while inside of them.
Deep hyperspace: Spawn nebula clouds. Hyperstorms will cause these clouds to zap anyone who draws near them, periodically, with a very powerful EMP bolt.
Black Holes: Drags all entities in combat towards the black hole, and increases time dilation of all ships.
Pulsars: Pushes all entities in combat away from the pulsar, reduces shield stats (efficiency, more upkeep, emp arc pierce chance), slowly generates hardflux, randomly EMPs ships, and charges all projectiles with a flat bonus to EMP damage.```

**Safe to add and remove from saves.**

Download: https://github.com/nikothedude/MoreCombatTerrainEffects/releases
Repo: https://github.com/nikothedude/MoreCombatTerrainEffects/tree/master
Forum thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=25567.0

items.description:
Makes exploration more interesting by adding sites to planets that allow you to perform various operations.
It's a mod about crafting the resources you need instead of returning home to restock.

It also adds a (completely optional) challenge that dramatically limits the usefulness of fuel tankers.
This makes it necessary to scavenge, steal, and craft fuel as you go.

Full description: <https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=26255.0>

***Note that this mod will not work with versions of Starsector prior to 0.97a-RC8***

Latest changes:
```fix
- Updated for Starsector 0.97a
- Added the Siphon Fuel ability from the Fuel Siphoning mod (which will eventually be discontinued)
- Added QoL improvements
- Added right-click function to topographic data: It now stabilizes your fleet's drive field
- Added reward for each time the max anomaly stage is reached: One topographic data
- Added a temporary message to let players know that there is a useful tooltip when hovering over the "Begin the operation" option
- Added a 3 new settings
- Added hull tags that allow mod authors to override the default fuel vulnerability level for their ships: sun_ns_protected, sun_ns_militarized, and sun_ns_vulnerable
- Fixes several issues (see full change log below)
- Changed: Planetary operation sites no longer spawn at Sentinel and other special mission-specific planets
- Changed: Marines now gain XP from planetary operations that use marines as an input
- Changed: The "Drive field stabilized" message will no longer appear if the Veteran Mode setting is on and only a short distance was traveled
```

items.name: Perilous Expanse
items.summary:
An overhaul of fuel economy that makes resource management and survival an integral part of exploration.
This mod is essentially an alternate version of Nomadic Survival with different default settings and a few additions.
items.description:
An overhaul of fuel economy that makes resource management and survival an integral part of exploration.
This mod is essentially an alternate version of Nomadic Survival with different default settings and a few additions.

Perilous Expanse makes the sector seem much larger. Not by increasing distances and travel times, but by making it necessary to find ways to refuel during long expeditions. It drastically limits how far you can travel without refueling, but it also provides several new ways to obtain fuel. This makes expeditions to distant stars a matter of careful planning or clever improvisation rather than just bringing more fuel tankers. Several parts of the map may even seem unreachable until you unlock new abilities, learn new tricks, discover helpful artifacts, or figure out new ways to craft fuel.

Full description: <https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=29047.0>

**A gameplay-first, balance friendly, completely configurable skill overhaul.** 
QC brings QOL features, meaningful choices, and more than 300 options to tweak the game to perfection.
items.description:
**A gameplay-first, balance friendly, completely configurable skill overhaul.** 
QC brings QOL features, meaningful choices, and more than 300 options to tweak the game to perfection. 
Every skill has been carefully curated for the the best features from every game version. Most skills are more flexible than before, designed to benefit every ship and excel on specialized craft. 
- Every skill is balanced against all the others and the choices you make will be based on how you want to play.
- Skills don't change their power based on your fleet size
- Also makes ECM and Navigation battle effects way more fun.
V1.5 introduced a **perk system** with milestones that your character automatically unlocks as they progress through the story. These milestones include powerful QOL features and most of the effects are completely fresh to the modiverse. 

V1.6 incorporates a few of the latest skill effects in 0.97, but the best part is **none of the +/- raw damage effects** are included. Enjoy Starsector at its **best**, with the full texture of the game. 

**Enjoy! Download is below ** or through the thread.

Direct DL: https://github.com/Dal-041/QualityCaptains/releases/latest/download/Quality.Captains.zip
Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21038.0

items.name: Random Weapon Collection
items.summary:
Adds a few weapons and some ships I wanted to make.
Still under construction, but releasing so people can try them out.
items.description:
Adds a few weapons and some ships I wanted to make.
Still under construction, but releasing so people can try them out.

Contains:
Egret- Midline capital carrier very similar to the Heron
Onslaught (B)- Onslaught variant with a beam TPC.  Does not spawn in NPC fleets/markets currently.
Conqueror- Midline battleship, fast but very poor rear arcs.  Comes with 2 fighter bays.
Javelin- Midline cruiser with AAF.  Main armament is 4 medium ballistics.

Devastation- Large slot HE ballistic weapon.   Will show up in mercenary fleets occasionally.
Mjolnir Heavy Cannon- Triple-barrel Mjolnir, good luck finding something with the flux to use this well. 
Autopulse Beam- Designed as a shitpost, is just an Autopulse Laser that was turned into a beam weapon.  Does not spawn in NPC fleets/markets currently.
Plasma Beam- Similar to the Autopulse Beam, but based on the Plasma Cannon.  Does not spawn in NPC fleets/markets currently.
Tachyon Accelerator- Projectile variant of Tachyon Lance.  Does not pierce shields.  
Light Mjolnir- Single-barrel Mjolnir, fits in medium slots.

Can be added mid-playthrough and should function correctly if done.

If you have a good idea for something I should add, let me know.  I might make it.  Maybe.
Balance feedback is appreciated
Known issues:
-Due to Persean League doctrine, the Egret will rarely spawn in faction stores.
-The Onslaught variant is terribly balanced.  This is fine. 
-Sounds for the beam weapons are terrible.  Will be fixed in a future release.

Forum link: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=28822.0

```Changelog:

Added the Tachyon Accelerator, a large slot energy weapon similar to the Tachyon Lance.  Has no shield-penetrating effect.

Save Compatible

items.name: Ship Browser 1.2
items.summary: Do you have a chronic mod addiction that makes the list ships command produce several pages of console output? Do you like testing out ideas for fleets but hate flicking though the variant editor for 5 minutes straight adding smods?  I do, and I have spent hours automating parts of these minor inconveniences.
items.description:
Do you have a chronic mod addiction that makes the list ships command produce several pages of console output? Do you like testing out ideas for fleets but hate flicking though the variant editor for 5 minutes straight adding smods?  I do, and I have spent hours automating parts of these minor inconveniences.

Some commands include:

**ShipBrowser**
Opens a gui ship browser that's organised by mod and ship class. The gui opens after the console is closed.

**CloneShip <shipNumber> [numberOfClones]**
Creates a copy of a specified ship in the player fleet. "shipNumber" is the order that ships appear in the refit screen. For example the fifth ship from the top in the refit sceen would be ship number 5. "numberOfClones" is a number that defaults to 1 if not specified.

**FindSystemsWithTags <manditory1stTag> [optionalAdditionalTags]**
List the star systems with all of the tags specified in the arguments. A list of tags can be found in com.fs.starfarer.api.impl.campaign.ids.Tags of the StarSector API. Input the string that corresponds to the tag obtained by viewing Constant Field Values. Can be used to find hypershunts and remnants

**AddDMods <shipSelection> <numDmods>**
Adds "numDmods" dmods to the ships specified by "shipSelection". "NumDmods" is a number. "shipSelection" can be a number (eg. 5), a range (eg, 5-10) or the word all. The numbers in "ShipSelection"  corresponds to the order ships appears in the fleet or refit screen. For example the fifth ship in the refit screen is ship 5.

A full list of commands can be found on the forum post. Note that some of the fleet editing commands don't work while the refit screen is open for some reason. No clue why

Download: https://github.com/itBeABruhmoment/ShipBrowser/releases/download/1.2/ShipBrowser1.2.zip
Forum: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=26261.msg390257#msg390257

SpeedUp
items.summary: Hold the middle mouse button and the game becomes 2x faster.  Controls are fully customizable.
items.description:
Hold the middle mouse button and the game becomes 2x faster.  Controls are fully customizable.

Ever wish the game would go by quicker while you're flying your lumbering Paragon up to the line of battle?  Ever wanted to push "fast forward" while your fleet mopped up the remnants of an enemy fleet?  Ever wanted to speed through a trivial Derelicts fight?  This mod is for you!

You can also press the caps lock key to toggle fast mode at your leisure.  The B button toggles the slow-down effect of phase systems.  Control-capslock toggles the game to run in as-fast-as-possible mode.  You can even set custom time scaling factors on separate inputs, if you like.

Download: https://bitbucket.org/DarkRevenant/speedup/downloads/SpeedUp_1.0.1.7z
